description: From Middle French ochlocratie, from Ancient Greek ὀχλοκρατία (okhlokratía), from ὄχλος (ókhlos, “multitude, crowd”) + κράτος (krátos, “power”).

entries.meaning: Mob rule; government by the masses; mobocracy. [from 1475–1485.]
examples: This constitutes a grave threat to the American Republic and degrades it into an Ochlocracy, or government by mob rule.
